claim_summary: Ark. Code § 16-98-304 provides that a drug court judge may order offenders to pay court costs, treatment costs, drug testing costs, local program user fees, supervision fees, and monitoring fees. The statute requires the judge to establish payment schedules, directs that court costs and program user fees be remitted to the court clerk for transfer to the county treasury, credits local program user fees to a local drug court program fund, and directs specified fees to the Department of Community Correction【5886943749931†L73-L110】.
